alert.note: Alert for Johnson; Morgan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Morgan, northwestern Johnson and northeastern Magoffin Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 514 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lenox, or near West Liberty, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Elamton, Elkfork, Florress and Williams around 525 PM EDT. Jeptha, Crockett and Matthew around 530 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Dingus, Haleburg, Logville, Cisco, Silverhill, Moon, Orient, Plutarch, Mima, Grayfox, Ever, Tella, Ophir, Relief, Lacey, Gillem Branch, Quod, Flat Fork, Coon, Perlie, Elna, Win, Minefork, Wheelersburg, Keaton, Leatha, Cyrus, Redbush, Hargis, Niles, Barnrock, Brownlow and Falcon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
